SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.database

Class DatabaseList

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<Person>
java.util.AbstractList<Person>
java.util.ArrayList<Person>
com.serezk4.database.DatabaseList
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Person>, Collection<Person>, List<Person>, RandomAccess, SequencedCollection<Person>
public final class DatabaseList extends ArrayList<Person>
A specialized list for managing Person objects with database integration.

The DatabaseList class extends ArrayList and overrides key methods to integrate with the PersonService. This ensures that changes to the list are reflected in the database and vice versa.

Key Features:

  • Adds a Person to the list and persists it to the database.
  • Removes a Person from the list and deletes it from the database by its ID.
  • Overrides the clear() method but marks it as deprecated since it is not implemented.

Usage:

 DatabaseList personList = new DatabaseList();
 Person person = new Person(1, "John Doe");
 personList.add(person); // Adds person to the list and saves it to the database
 personList.remove(person); // Removes person from the list and the database

Thread Safety:

This class is not thread-safe. External synchronization is required if used in a concurrent environment.

See Also:

  • PersonService

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add(Person person)
      Adds a Person to the list and persists it to the database.

      This method ensures that the specified Person is saved to the database using the PersonService. If the save operation succeeds, the person is added to the list.

      Workflow:

      • Checks if the person is not null.
      • Calls PersonService.save(Person) to persist the person to the database.
      • If successful, adds the person to the list and logs the action.
      Specified by:
      add in interface Collection<Person>
      Specified by:
      add in interface List<Person>
      Overrides:
      add in class ArrayList<Person>
      Parameters:
      person - the Person to be added to the list.
      Returns:
      true if the person was added to the list and saved to the database; false otherwise.

    • remove

      public Person remove(int index)
      Removes the Person at the specified index and deletes it from the database.

      This method retrieves the Person at the specified index, removes it from the list, and deletes it from the database by its ID using the PersonService.

      Workflow:

      • Retrieves the person at the specified index.
      • Calls PersonService.removeById(int) to delete the person from the database.
      • Removes the person from the list and logs the action.
      Specified by:
      remove in interface List<Person>
      Overrides:
      remove in class ArrayList<Person>
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the Person to remove.
      Returns:
      the Person that was removed from the list.

      Removes the Person at the specified index and deletes it from the database.

      This method retrieves the Person at the specified index, removes it from the list, and deletes it from the database by its ID using the PersonService.

      Workflow:

      • Calls PersonService.removeById(int) to delete the person from the database.
      • Removes the person from the list and logs the action.

    • clear

      @Deprecated public void clear()
      Deprecated.
      Clearing all elements is not supported.
      Clears all elements from the list.

      This method is marked as deprecated and throws an UnsupportedOperationException since it is not implemented. Clearing the list and database simultaneously is not supported by this class.

      Specified by:
      clear in interface Collection<Person>
      Specified by:
      clear in interface List<Person>
      Overrides:
      clear in class ArrayList<Person>
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown since this method is not implemented.
